title: Smartgoat
author: Smartgoat
content: A scammer called one of my friend with one number claiming to be me and possibly mimicked my voice using A1 or whatever. He claimed that his phone was off because he slept in the hospital. for my friend I was the one talking. He told him that my mother was at hospital laying critically sick and  ask for financial support.He told him  that he needed $2000 to make initial deposit to  enable the doctors commerce treatment. He was sounding very pitiable and helpless. my friend thought I was truly the one calling and had sympathy and pity and requested for account details but surprisingly the account details the scammer sent wasn't beering my name. my friend called me and it rang. He was surprised and asked if I had charged my phone. I told him my phone has been on. He ask about my mother , I told him my mother was good at home He ask me my location and I told him I was at work. He then told me what is happening. I quickly called him on WhatsApp video to show him it was a scam and that neither my mother nor myself was in the hospital.scammers have deviced another means of scamming and defrauding people. thank God my friend didn't transfered money to the thief. we have been calling the number since then but switched off. A lot of things are happening.       please, if You received a distress text message or call from your friends or relatives asking for financial help , verify before you  send the money especially if the account details and phone number is not that of your relatives or friend in questions.what can we do, to avoid being a victim.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: That scam is common everywhere and I think before they attack a target, they're knowing first details of the victim that they're going to copy. That's why they're also observant before doing the scam and you don't display all your sensitive information on the web or any social media platform.Quote from: Smartgoat on August 24, 2023, 10:10:21 PMwhat can we do, to avoid being a victim.Talk to your family that you should have a sign or words to say that you're actually legit the ones talking to them and vice versa. If that word isn't mentioned by the caller then that means it's not you that's calling them for help. Start to do this in circle of your family and have yourselves call sign that you and them only know it, don't tell it publicly because the scammer might know what you're up to and will also copy that call sign of yours or anything that's going to be unique and you can identify each of yourselves easily.

comments.author: Stepstowealth
comments.body: The number of scammers are increasing and the number of methods are also increasing. Scammers try to make use of new technology before a number of people know about them to defraud their victims before the technology becomes popular. For these new kind of scams, a way to avoid falling victim is to always verify and ask for reasonable evidence. I understand that friends and family are supposed to help each other, but even for that reason, no one has the right to demand my money that I disciplined myself to keep, nobody has the right to demand for it via emergency that will make me make decisions without thinking.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Smartgoat on August 24, 2023, 10:10:21 PMwhat can we do, to avoid being a victim.We can't do anything else then getting proper awareness related to such scams. I have also heard a similar story sometime ago and the scammers used same kind of AI voice cloning tools to scam many people by mimicking the voice of their loved ones. Sometimes we really can't decide that what to do in such situations and we become helpless because the scammers create a scenario that we can't ignore at any cost. Like in your friend's case he had no option but to send money to his friend because his friend's mother was in hospital and a good friend will most probably help in such situations without asking for much details, but your friend was smart enough that he called you because otherwise he would have lost his $2000 to a scammer. I think you've done a great job by telling us about that scamming tactic those scammers tried on your friend because such threads can educate others to be aware of such scams and they can then avoid being victim of such scams. AI is really going to cause much trouble in future, and that's why I think we should be well prepared to find solutions for those troubles in advance.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Smartgoat on August 24, 2023, 10:10:21 PMwhat can we do, to avoid being a victim.1) Make sure you keep your personal information safe. Don't expose your information on third-party platforms and social media2) Ensure you secure your phone from hacking and phishing. Avoid clicking on links randomly without checks. 3) Don't be greedy because scammers always come up with enticing schemes with high profits. 4) In any case of hack or security compromise ensure you go through the right recovery and security process. 5) Be sensitive and avoid making hasty decisions. When you receive such calls or messages contact the people involved and don't rush into action. Your friend was able to outsmart the scammers because he didn't allow the situation to distort his sense of reasoning. He had to confirm the situation with you first.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Be cautious with personal information, avoid sharing sensitive details like passwords or financial information unless absolutely necessary. Always double & triple check emails, websites or callers before providing any information. Look for signs of legitimacy such as official email addresses or secure website connections. Always use strong, unique passwords, create complex passwords for different accounts and consider using a password manager.Be skeptical of unsolicited communication: Be wary of unexpected emails, calls, or messages asking for personal information or urgent action.. Keep software up to date, regularly update your operating system, antivirus & other software to ensure security patches are in place. Enable two-factor authentication, use this additional layer of security whenever possible to protect your accounts.

comments.body: A few months ago I had the same case, a stranger called home telling my parents that I was very sick and needed a lot of money. he said his voice was similar to mine, I don't know what technology they use, but the more the fraudsters come here the more terrible.

comments.body: Quote from: MegameSama on September 02, 2023, 02:33:51 PMA few months ago I had the same case, a stranger called home telling my parents that I was very sick and needed a lot of money. he said his voice was similar to mine, I don't know what technology they use, but the more the fraudsters come here the more terrible.There's a technology, tool or app that allows the caller to change their voice and it's just a few taps away during the call. And that's why it's easy to copy the voice of their targets.But these scammers won't just attack and call you right away. They're wise and will do some studies first on what kind of voice the victim have and they'll resonate with the voice based on what they heard.So, you probably have met or talked to them and they've got some recorder or just on their minds and have it remembered as they copy your voice and call your relatives.
